Description: Papyrus (mounted in 6 frames) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (10 cols., each of 24-26 ll. except the last of 19 ll.) and verso (7 cols. of varying size). Thompson's MS Catalogue (referring to the whole papyrus): "recto: the proceedings of a native court of justice consisting of three priests with a Greek assessor in a civil suit arising out of the document no. 10575 supra. verso: copies of documents relating to the text of the recto. Date year 11 Pachons 21 of Ptolemy Philometor = BC. 170 June 23". Here shown are cols. 1-3 (pls. 1-3 of Thompson's edition), containing the records of the trial. Nos. 10575-10601 from the Siut Archive.
Curator's comments: Bibliography Depauw, The Demotic Letter (2006), 354 with proposed new readings. Felber, H., Demotische Ackerpachtverträge (ÄA 58). Wiesbaden, 1997, pg. 83. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.43, no.1, diagr. C, no.8) (see p.187 for genealogy)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43343) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43343)
